intro: Melandrium cabulicum, commonly known as the Persian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Melandrium cabulicum is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
